ai.summary: A 6.3 km moderate circular hike through marshland in the UK, featuring boardwalks, wetlands, and open scenery. Suitable for hikers with moderate fitness who enjoy wildlife and a fairly flat route with some uneven sections.
ai.terrain_summary: Flat to gently undulating marshland with long boardwalk sections, occasional muddy or grassy paths, and wet conditions are possible.
ai.safety_notes: Wear waterproof footwear and layered clothing; be prepared for muddy sections and slippery boards; stay on marked paths; watch for wildlife and avoid disturbing breeding birds; bring water and sun protection; check weather and forecast before you go; keep dogs on a leash where required.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly Marchâ€“October) when the wetlands are most active and conditions are drier.

seo.title: Ham Wall Loop Hike - 6.3 km Moderate Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the 6.3 km Ham Wall Loop, a moderate marshland hike in the UK featuring boardwalks, wildlife, and scenic wetland views. Plan your day with practical safety tips and gear.
